Comment: Recessed Meeting of June 14, 2016 HELD on June 21, 2016

Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Muhammad Shamsi Ali, Spiritual Leader of Jamaica Muslim Center, 84-42 Chapin Parkway, Jamaica, N.Y. 11432.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Miller.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:  Muhammad Shamsi Ali, Spiritual Leader of Jamaica Muslim Center, 84-42 Chapin Parkway, Jamaica, N.Y. 11432.

Council Member Miller moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Constantinides moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 25, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Application No. C 160140 ZSQ submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-52 of the Zoning Resolution to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 229 spaces on a portion of the ground floor and cellar level of a proposed mixed use development on property located at 133-45 41st Avenue (Block 5037, Lots 64 & 65), in a C4-5X District, Borough of Queens, Community Board 7, Council District 20. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(2) or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(3).
Items.AgendaNote: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.70(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.

Items.Title: Application No. C 160141 ZSQ submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-681 of the Zoning Resolution to allow that portion of the right-of-way or yard where railroad or transit use has been permanently discontinued or terminated to be included in the lot area, in connection with a proposed mixed-use development on property located at 133-45 41st Avenue (Block 5037, Lots 64 & 65), in a C4-5X District, Borough of Queens, Community Board 7, Council District 20. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(2) or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(3).

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would make it illegal to declaw a cat.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Make it illegal to declaw a cat.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the sale of cosmetic talc in the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Banning the sale of cosmetic talc in the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting and publication of information about privately owned public spaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Reporting and publication of information about privately owned public spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of web analytics for city agency websites
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Use of web analytics for city agency websites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to required notice of the rights of people with disabilities to use service animals in public accommodations
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Required notice of the rights of people with disabilities to use service animals in public accommodations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the use of carryout bags
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Reducing the use of carryout bags.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the contract award threshold requiring a vendor doing business with the city to complete a VENDEX questionnaire
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Increasing the contract award threshold requiring a vendor doing business with the city to complete a VENDEX questionnaire.

Items.Title: Resolution raising the small purchase limit for goods, services, construction and construction-related services to two hundred thousand dollars upon adoption of a concurrent rule amendment by the Procurement Policy Board
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Raising the small purchase limit for goods, services, construction and construction-related services to $200,000 upon adoption of a concurrent rule amendment by the Procurement Policy Board.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to submit a plan for serving the behavioral health needs of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and questioning persons.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to submit a plan for serving the behavioral health needs of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and questioning persons.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to 311 transmitting image and video data for housing service requests or complaints
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: 311 transmitting image and video data for housing service requests or complaints.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.6279, the Deny Firearms to Dangerous Terrorists Act, which would prohibit individuals on the federal Terrorist Watchlist from obtaining and possessing firearms.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Deny Firearms to Dangerous Terrorists Act (S.6279)

Items.Title: The Public Advocate will call the meeting to order
Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) called the Meeting to order.

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) announced the presence of a quorum.

Items.Title: The Public Advocate will adjourn the recessed meeting
Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned the Recessed Meeting of June 14, 2016 held on June 21, 2016.

Items.Title: STATED MEETING - JUNE 21, 2016
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of feminine hygiene products
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of feminine hygiene products in schools
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Provision of feminine hygiene products in schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the New York State Legislature to pass and the President of the United States and Governor of the State of New York to sign, legislation to establish October 9th annually, as Haitian Day in recognition of the historic contributions of Haitians to the United States of America
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish October 9th annually, as Haitian Day in recognition of the historic contributions of Haitians to the United States of America.

Items.Title: Resolution establishing October 9th annually as New York City Haitian Day, in recognition of the historic contributions of the Haitian diaspora to the City of New York
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establishing October 9th annually as NYC Haitian Day, in recognition of the historic contributions of the Haitian diaspora to the City of NY.

Items.Title: Resolution acknowledging the passage by the New York State Legislature and calling upon the Governor to sign legislation that amends the Tax Law to exempt feminine hygiene products from all state and local sales taxes.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Amends the Tax Law to exempt feminine hygiene products from all state and local sales taxes.

Items.Title: Application No. C 160140 ZSQ submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-52 of the Zoning Resolution to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 229 spaces on a portion of the ground floor and cellar level of a proposed mixed use development on property located at 133-45 41st Avenue (Block 5037, Lots 64 & 65), in a C4-5X District, Borough of Queens, Community Board 7, Council District 20. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(2) or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(3).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application No. C 160141 ZSQ submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-681 of the Zoning Resolution to allow that portion of the right-of-way or yard where railroad or transit use has been permanently discontinued or terminated to be included in the lot area, in connection with a proposed mixed-use development on property located at 133-45 41st Avenue (Block 5037, Lots 64 & 65), in a C4-5X District, Borough of Queens, Community Board 7, Council District 20. Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 871-A   47-2-0 (Negative: CMs Borelli and Matteo);

Preconsidered Int. No. 1223,  38-11-0 (Negative: CMs Borelli, Dickens, Greenfield, Grodenchik, Lancman, Palma, Rose, Treyger, Ulrich, Vacca, and Matteo)

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, July 14, 2016.


MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 49 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
